description: From Late Middle English equivocaten, from Medieval Latin aequivocātus, perfect passive participle of aequivocō (“I am called by the same name”), from Late Latin aequivocus (“ambiguous, equivocal”). Compare French équivoquer.

verbs.description: equivocate (third-person singular simple present equivocates, present participle equivocating, simple past and past participle equivocated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To speak using double meaning; to speak ambiguously, unclearly or doubtfully, with intent to deceive.
examples: Synonyms: prevaricate, evade, shuffle, quibble, adumbrate
